title: How to get vaccinated for COVID-19
author: Government Communications; Public Engagement
description: To get vaccinated against COVID-19, you must register with the Get Vaccinated system.
cleaned_text: How to get vaccinated for COVID-19 To get vaccinated against COVID-19, you must register with the Get Vaccinated system. English | [](/gov/content/covid-19/translation/tc/register) | [](/gov/content/covid-19/translation/sc/register) | [Français](/gov/content/covid-19/translation/fr/register) | [](/gov/content/covid-19/translation/pun/register) [](/gov/content/covid-19/translation/ukr/register) updated: August 18, 2023 On this page: [Register with the Get Vaccinated system](#register) [Book your to expect at your appointment](#what-to-expect) [I need help](#help) Register with the Get Vaccinated system You can register yourself or someone else, like a parent, grandparent or child. We will never ask you for your SIN, driver's licence number or banking and credit card details. Fastest option: Online To register online, you must provide: - First and last name - Date of birth - Postal code - Personal Health Number (PHN) - An email address that gets checked regularly or a phone number that can receive text messages Find your PHN on the back of your B.C. driver's licence, BC Services Card or CareCard. [Register online](https://getvaccinated.gov.bc.ca) It takes 2 minutes. Other registration and booking options If you don't have a Personal Health Number (PHN), you need to register by phone. A PHN will be created for you. Call: [1-833-838-2323](tel:+1-833-838-2323) | Translators are available Monday to Friday, 7 am to 7 pm (PDT) Outside Canada and the USA: [1-604-681-4261](tel:+1-604-681-4261) Telephone for the Deaf: Dial [711](tel:711) [Video Relay Services (VRS) provides sign language interpretation](https://srvcanadavrs.ca/en/) free for registered deaf, hard of hearing or speech-impaired people. You can register in-person at all Service BC offices. Office hours vary by location. Check before you go. Everyone can get vaccinated, even if you don't have a PHN or other documentation. It doesn't matter if you are a Canadian citizen or not. Register even if you have already received a dose in another location. All of your information will be kept private and will never be shared with other agencies or parts of government. Update your contact information To make sure that you get notified when it's time for your next vaccination, it's important to keep your contact information in Get Vaccinated up-to-date. Book your appointment After you register, we send you a booking invitation link. Use the link to book your vaccine appointment online or by phone. It's easy and guarantees your spot at a community pharmacy or vaccination clinic near you. - If needed, you can [easily reschedule your appointment online](#reschedule) - If you can't find your booking link, you can [get a new one](https://www.getvaccinated.gov.bc.ca/s/resend-booking-link) If you've already been vaccinated against COVID-19 in another province or country, [make sure your B.C. vaccination records are up-to-date](https://www.immunizationrecord.gov.bc.ca/). Getting your next doses When you're eligible for your next dose, we send you another booking invitation. Like your first appointment, you'll select a location, date and time. You'll get an invitation approximately 56 days after your first dose, to get your second dose. You're encouraged to bring your [immunization record card](/assets/gov/public-safety-and-emergency-services/emergency-preparedness-response-recovery/gdx/bccdc-covid-vaccination-card-sample-both-sides.png) or show your [online immunization record on Health Gateway](http://www.healthgateway.gov.bc.ca/) at your appointment. For additional vaccinations after your second dose, visit [get an additional COVID-19 vaccination](/gov/content/covid-19/vaccine/booster) for more information. What to expect at your appointment Review [COVID-19 vaccine safety information from HealthLink BC](https://www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/covid-19-mrna-vaccines) before your appointment. Plan to be at your appointment for 15 to 30 minutes. Arrive prepared Get ready for your appointment: - You don't need to fast. Be sure to drink water - Bring your booking confirmation and photo ID - Wear a short-sleeved shirt and a mask. You will be provided a mask if you need one - Arrive a few minutes before your scheduled appointment time During the appointment At the pharmacy or clinic you will: - Check-in with your photo ID and booking confirmation. For modesty, you can ask for a private location to get your shot - Get your vaccine dose - Wait in an observation area after your shot for about 15 minutes After your appointment, review [COVID-19 Vaccination Aftercare (PDF, 953KB)](http://www.bccdc.ca/Health-Info-Site/Documents/COVID-19_vaccine/VaccinationAftercare.pdf) from the British Columbia Centre for Disease Control. I need help If you're 12 or older and would prefer a non-mRNA vaccine, there is limited supply of [Novavax](https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/services/drugs-health-products/covid19-industry/drugs-vaccines-treatments/vaccines/novavax.html) vaccine available in pharmacies. A new non-mRNA vaccine will be available this fall that offers better protection against the latest variants. If you would like Novavax now, select the non-mRNA vaccine option when you book your appointment online or call the call centre. Even if you've already had COVID-19 and recovered, you should still get vaccinated. If you were recently sick, you can get the vaccine once your symptoms have passed. If you have an appointment but you still have symptoms, [reschedule](https://www.getvaccinated.gov.bc.ca/s/cancel-booking) for when you will be fully recovered. Rescheduling your appointment is easy and can be done online 24 hours a day. [Reschedule my appointment](https://www.getvaccinated.gov.bc.ca/s/cancel-booking) Note: You must have your confirmation number. Call [1-833-838-2323](tel:+1-833-838-2323). The call centre team can correct the information for you. Outside Canada and the USA: [1-604-681-4261](tel:+1-604-681-4261) Do not register again. If you got one or two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine in another province or country, you must: - Register with the [Get Vaccinated provincial registration system](/gov/content/covid-19/vaccine/register#register) - Submit proof of an official immunization record. It will be entered into the Provincial Immunization Registry
